titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Abbie G. Sanderson Papers
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 2, 2019 at 22:03

did.unittitle: Abbie G. Sanderson Papers
did.abstract: Detailed family correspondence, writings, and collected material document the life and work of a single woman missionary in South China. Abbie G. Sanderson was an American Baptist missionary in South China from 1918 to 1937 and 1946 to 1953. She later taught at a girls' school in Sendai, Japan, and retired in 1959.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Abbie G. Sanderson Papers (RG 149), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Abbie G. Sanderson was born in Greenville, New Hampshire on May 27, 1893. She graduated from Coburn Classical Institute and Colby College, Waterville, Maine. After teaching in Maine for two years, she sailed to Swatow in 1918. She served the South China Baptist Mission (American Baptist) in the Swatow area from 1918 to 1937 and 1946 to 1953, teaching at the Abigail Hart Scott Memorial School, also known as Kak Chieh Girls' School.

Primarily based in Swatow, Sanderson spent some summer months in cooler areas such as Kuliang, Fukien. She was on furlough in the U.S. during 1924, returning to China in December of that year. From May to October 1927 she was stationed in the Philippines due to disruptions in the Swatow area. Sanderson was on furlough in the U.S. in 1931, returning to Swatow in February of 1932. She extended her furlough in 1937 due to her father's health, and then was prevented by the war from returning to China until 1946. Sanderson was held in solitary confinement for twenty-one months prior to her release from Communist China in 1953. She taught at a girls' school in Sendai, Japan from 1954 until her retirement in 1959.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The bulk of this collection is Sanderson's detailed, regular letters to her family in the U.S. This record group complements the papers of other Baptist missionaries to South China held by YDSL, including those of the Campbell family, Hartwell family, Ellison and Lottie Hildreth.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Portions of the collection have been digitized. See: http://divinity-adhoc.library.yale.edu/AbbieSandersonPapers/

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Much of the correspondence has been digitized. See: http://divinity-adhoc.library.yale.edu/AbbieSandersonPapers/

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes general letters to friends and to the churches that supported her.

altformavail.p: Much of this series has been digitized. See: http://divinity-adhoc.library.yale.edu/AbbieSandersonPapers/

did.unittitle: "Diary and Daily Reminder" (bound volume with notes and diary entries, 1935); "Five Year Diary" (with brief entries for 1936)

Typescript writings of AGS, incl.: ""Description of a Trip on a Houseboat" (1919); "Laying the Corner Stone of the Jubilee Building, Swatow, China"; "The Appeal of the Present Situation in Young People's Work"
Issue of "The New East" periodical including article by AGS: "The Kak Chieh Girls' School" (1921); fragments of writings
Personal Items and Memorabilia
Biographical documentation of AGS, including passport, brochure, Colby College information form, newspaper clippings
Dress designs, lists of names and household items, financial documents
Collected Material
Documentation re. the Abigail Hart Scott Memorial School, Swatow, and other Baptist mission work in South China
Tracts, pamphlets re. China, Japan, and Philippines, incl. "Woman in China" by Adele M. Fielde, "New Life from Within" by Madame Chiang Kai-shek; other miscellaneous typescript writings
Newspaper clippings regarding missionaries in China under Communists
Chinese language material incl. two hymnals, tract titled "Be a Fiery Christian", words to hymns in Swatow Chinese, music sheets for quartet
Photographs

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Many of the photographs have been digitized. Search for Sanderson at http://web.library.yale.edu/digital-collections/divinity-library-photographs
